page.title: 05WHITLEIGH WOODS
page.content: People walk and play in woods but, unfortunately, some damage is sometimes caused.Many people are worried about the future of our woodlands.The National Trust and The Woodland Trust are buying and conserving woods for the public.Many new woods consist of coniferous trees which cannot support as much wildlife as deciduous woodlands.Trees like Oak, Ash and Beech are not being grown because they take too long to grow for a quick profit. There are Badgers and Foxes living in Whitleigh woods and they make trails along the woodland floor.Grey Squirrels are common and cause much damage to trees. Some of us think, that in the future, housing will take the place of all our woodland but we hope this will not happen.
